function.name: date
function.description: Creates a date based on the provided arguments:If no arguments are provided, it will return a date based on now()If the first argument is a number, it will treat this number as a unix timestampIf the first argument is a string, it will parse it based on the default format of yyyy-MM-dd’T’hh:mm:ss:S. An alternative format to be used can be passed as second parameter.The timezone argument can be used to indicate the timezone that is used for the provided date. When no timezone is provided, ‘Europe/Amsterdam’ will be used. A list of allowed timezones values is provided below.

examples.example: ACT AET Africa/Abidjan Africa/Accra Africa/Addis_Ababa Africa/Algiers Africa/Asmera Africa/Bamako Africa/Bangui Africa/Banjul Africa/Bissau Africa/Blantyre Africa/Brazzaville
